alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 11:29PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Gusty winds and brief heavy rain will impact portions of northwestern Fergus, Blaine, Hill and northeastern Chouteau Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1127 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and some embedded thunderstorms along a line extending from 19 miles north of Fort Benton to 15 miles northeast of Winifred. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and brief downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Havre, Fort Benton, Chinook, Big Sandy, Harlem, Winifred, Parker School, Beaver Creek, Hays, Azure, Agency, St. Pierre, Gildford, Sangrey, Boneau, Fort Belknap, Box Elder, Hingham, Rudyard and Rocky Boy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Localized heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County
